Class javachart.chart.Bar 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Bar
public class Bar
extends Object

dataXfm
Used to transform this Bar's data into a pixel space defined by the X and Y Axis and the chart's Plotarea.

Bar(Dataset[], AxisInterface, AxisInterface, Plotarea)
Constructs a new Bar component, used for creating the bars in a vertical bar chart (or ColumnChart).

buildDataXfm()
Initializes dataXfm, which is used for drawing Bar representations
datasetsInUse()
returns the number of Datasets actually used by this Bar
doBar(Graphics, double, int, int, boolean)
draws an individual column
doBarLabel(Graphics, double, int, int)
draws a single column's label
doBars(Graphics, boolean)
Called by draw to draw actual bars and labels
doDBar(Graphics, double, int, int, boolean)
draws a single column with a dimensional effect
draw(Graphics)
Draws the datasets contained in this Bar on the specified Graphic class, using each Dataset's Gc class to determine graphical attributes.
drawInd(Graphics)
Draws the datasets contained in this Bar class on the specified Graphics class, using each Datum's Gc class to determine graphical attributes.
drawSet(Graphics, int, boolean)
Draws a single Dataset from the array of Dataset classes used by this bar.
getBaseline()
Returns the current baseline.
getClusterWidth()
Returns the current cluster width.
getDoClip()
Returns true if bars should be clipped at Plotarea boundaries
getLabelAngle()
Set the angle for bar labels.
getLabelFormat()
Returns this Bar's label format value.
getLabelPrecision()
Returns the bar labels' floating point display precision.
getLabelsOn()
Returns true if each bar will display a label
getUseDisplayList()
Returns true if Bar objects will appear in global DisplayList.
setBaseline(double)
Set the Bar baseline.
setClusterWidth(double)
Returns the current cluster width
setDoClip(boolean)
Set to true to clip bars at Plotarea boundaries.
setLabelAngle(int)
Returns the bar label angle
setLabelFormat(int)
Determines what format to use for this Bar's labels.
setLabelPrecision(int)
Set the labels' floating point display precision.
setLabelsOn(boolean)
Set to true if you wish to label each bar.
setUseDisplayList(boolean)
Determines whether Bar objects should be added to global DisplayList.

dataXfm 
  protected Transform dataXfm
Used to transform this Bar's data into a pixel space defined by the X and Y Axis and the chart's Plotarea.

Bar 
  public Bar(Dataset d[],
             AxisInterface xAx,
             AxisInterface yAx,
             Plotarea subplot)
Constructs a new Bar component, used for creating the bars in a vertical bar chart (or ColumnChart).
Parameters:
d - Datasets considered by this component
xAx - X axis for labelling these bars
yAx - Y axis for scaling these bars
subplot - The Plotarea beneath these bars

getDoClip 
  public boolean getDoClip()
Returns true if bars should be clipped at Plotarea boundaries
Returns:
Status of clipping
setDoClip 
  public void setDoClip(boolean onOff)
Set to true to clip bars at Plotarea boundaries. Defaults to false.
Parameters:
onOff - New status of clipping
draw 
  public synchronized void draw(Graphics g)
Draws the datasets contained in this Bar on the specified Graphic class, using each Dataset's Gc class to determine graphical attributes.
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw on.
See Also:
Dataset
drawInd 
  public synchronized void drawInd(Graphics g)
Draws the datasets contained in this Bar class on the specified Graphics class, using each Datum's Gc class to determine graphical attributes.
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw on.
See Also:
Datum
getUseDisplayList 
  public boolean getUseDisplayList()
Returns true if Bar objects will appear in global DisplayList.
Returns:
current status
setUseDisplayList 
  public void setUseDisplayList(boolean onOff)
Determines whether Bar objects should be added to global DisplayList. Default is true.
Parameters:
onOff - true if Bar objects go into DisplayList
See Also:
DisplayList, Globals, Chart
getLabelsOn 
  public boolean getLabelsOn()
Returns true if each bar will display a label
Returns:
Current status of label display
setLabelsOn 
  public void setLabelsOn(boolean onOff)
Set to true if you wish to label each bar. Default is false. If a Datum has a label defined, that label will be displayed. If no label string is defined in the Datum for a particular bar, a value will display instead.
Parameters:
onOff - New status of label display
getClusterWidth 
  public double getClusterWidth()
Returns the current cluster width. This number is a percentage relative to the amount of space available for each group of bars at a single position on the X axis. If the value is 1.0, the group of bars at the first position on the X axis will touch the group of bars at the second position on the X axis. The default cluster width is 0.8.
Returns:
Current value of cluster width
setClusterWidth 
  public void setClusterWidth(double num)
Returns the current cluster width
Parameters:
num - sets the width of a bar cluster
Returns:
desired width of a bar cluster
getBaseline 
  public double getBaseline()
Returns the current baseline.
Returns:
Current baseline
setBaseline 
  public void setBaseline(double num)
Set the Bar baseline. Data values above this number will ascend from the baseline, values below this number will descend from the baseline. The default baseline is 0.
Parameters:
num - New value of base line
getLabelAngle 
  public int getLabelAngle()
Set the angle for bar labels. Default value is 0.
Parameters:
num - bar label angle in degrees
setLabelAngle 
  public void setLabelAngle(int num)
Returns the bar label angle
Returns:
label angle
setLabelFormat 
  public void setLabelFormat(int num)
Determines what format to use for this Bar's labels. The default is Gc.DEFAULT_FORMAT, which is a machine-dependent representation for Java 1.0x, and may include Scientific notation. Other possibilities include Gc.COMMA_FORMAT, which formats numbers as 1,000.00 and Gc.EURO_FORMAT, which formats numbers like 1.000,00.
Parameters:
i - label format
getLabelFormat 
  public int getLabelFormat()
Returns this Bar's label format value.
Returns:
label format
getLabelPrecision 
  public int getLabelPrecision()
Returns the bar labels' floating point display precision. A precision of 2 yields labels like "1.11". A precision of 4 makes labels like "1.1111"
Returns:
label precision
setLabelPrecision 
  public void setLabelPrecision(int num)
Set the labels' floating point display precision.
Parameters:
num - A new label precision
buildDataXfm 
  protected void buildDataXfm()
Initializes dataXfm, which is used for drawing Bar representations
doBars 
  protected void doBars(Graphics g,
                        boolean individualColors)
Called by draw to draw actual bars and labels
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw on
individualColors - use Datum colors if true
drawSet 
  protected synchronized void drawSet(Graphics g,
                                      int setNumber,
                                      boolean individualColors)
Draws a single Dataset from the array of Dataset classes used by this bar.
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw on
setNumber - which Dataset to use
individualColors - use Datum colors if true
datasetsInUse 
  protected int datasetsInUse()
returns the number of Datasets actually used by this Bar
doBar 
  protected void doBar(Graphics g,
                       double howWide,
                       int whichSet,
                       int whichBar,
                       boolean individualColors)
draws an individual column
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw
howWide - relative width of bar
whichSet - Dataset array index
whichBar - Datum element number
individualColors - True if colors come from Datum
doBarLabel 
  protected void doBarLabel(Graphics g,
                            double howWide,
                            int whichSet,
                            int whichBar)
draws a single column's label
Parameters:
g - Graphics class to draw
howWide - relative width of bar
whichSet - Dataset array index
whichBar - Datum element number
doDBar 
  protected void doDBar(Graphics g,
                        double howWide,
                        int whichSet,
                        int whichBar,
                        boolean individualColors)
draws a single column with a dimensional effect
Parameters:
g - Graphics to draw
whichSet - Dataset array index
whichBar - Datum element in Dataset
individualColors - True if bar color should come from Datum Gc
